intro: Strophopappus villosus, commonly known as the hairy eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a tall, erect stem covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically pink to lavender in color and bloom in late summer to early fall. Strophopappus villosus is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
